column4: I have a Microsoft Comfort Optical Mouse 3000 and I am trying to get all the buttons working. Instructions I find say to modify the InputDevice section of my xorg.conf file but there is no InputDevice section...where do I make the changes?
you create one... man page for xorg.conf
will I need to restart?
how do I do that?
log out, wait for a new login
I can see you. I'm just not answering.
mainly because I don't know (1) what you're asking, and (2) how to answer
my network card/internet will not work after a restart, I even tried an extra card, still nothing
I am on a second machine, connected via KVM
several times, like I said, I even installed other cards
so, what card is it?
original was onboard card, extra I installed/tried was a linksys
correct, I cannot get internet/networking
I'll leave you in the capable hands of phoenixandthor
hm? whatsucks?
my problem is complicated and I can't get help
heh. Depends.
let me guess... on a Ubuntu-based system?
yes, of course
hm. Then that's a wee bit of a problem. Check dates on:  ls -l /var/lib/dpkg/info/*.list
brb to try that
that list was huge, and unusable
you want to sort by date. There's a parameter for ls to sort by date.
your question was: what are the latest packages I've installed... right?
